answers.answer: Dear Speck,I am not familiar with the term "Autonomic Decompensation Syndrome".  I suspect your doctor is using this term to describe a varient of "Pure Autonomic failue (PAF)" or "Autonomic failure with multiple system atrophy".  These are the main recognized primary autonomic diseases.  There are many secondary causes of autonomic dysfunction such as diabetes, amyloid and drugs.  You can find further information about primary and secondary autonomic failure at www.ndrf.org.Concerning your second question- If you actually passed out it would no longer be considered a pre-syncope episode but a syncope episode.  If you only became "hazy" this would be consistent with pre-syncope.
